metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4338 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The mysql user parameter configuration script (userparameter_mysql.conf) in the agent in Zabbix before 2.0.18, 2.2.x before 2.2.13, and 3.0.x before 3.0.3, when used with a shell other than bash, allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code or SQL commands via the mysql.size parameter. It was discovered that Zabbix incorrectly handled certain inputs. An attacker could possibly use this to execute arbitrary code or SQL commands.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zabbix-agent - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1
zabbix-frontend-php - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1
zabbix-java-gateway - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-mysql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-pgsql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1
zabbix-proxy-sqlite3 - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-mysql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1
zabbix-server-pgsql - 1:3.0.12+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zabbix package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:3.0.12+dfsg-1').
